caption:
This photograph captures a city landscape viewed from a higher vantage point through a haze, likely indicating either early morning fog or smog. In the foreground, the scene includes a road bending around a lush area dotted with green trees. The road is marked with a yellow right-turn arrow sign, suggesting a curve ahead, and several cars are visible traveling on the road. Various vehicles, including a red car and a dark-colored car, add a touch of color and movement to the scene.

The midground is a mix of green spaces and scattered trees, contrasting with the urban environment. A distinct feature in the middle distance is a bridge, hinting at the city's infrastructure for navigating waterways or ravines.

In the background, the city skyline emerges through a misty haze, with several high-rise buildings making up the city's core. Notably, a tall, slender tower stands prominently, possibly a landmark structure within the city. The overall atmosphere of the photograph is slightly muted due to the haze, providing a sense of depth and distance. The natural elements in the foreground juxtaposed with the urban skyline create a dynamic interplay between nature and urban development.
title: On july 20, 1973--day of a pollution alert--Cleveland skyline is barely visible from west shoreway
